remarks: The Fundamental Theorem of Algebra.  Any polynomial with positive degree (i.e. non-constant) has a root.  This is Metamath 100 proof #2. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2014.)
statement:
fta $p |- ( ( F e. ( Poly ` S ) /\ ( deg ` F ) e. NN ) -> E. z e. CC ( F ` z ) = 0 ) $.
$d F z $.
$d S z $.
